a.xlink:title: Smallholders fragmented by inheritance; often credit-constrained; chronic tail-end shortages in many commands.

Accord partitions provincial shares; distributional justice at outlet scale remains unresolved.
a.text: Tail-end shortages persist despite 1991 Accord; local inequities at canal/watercourse scale.

a.xlink:title: Sharecropping persists in Sindh; local elite capture of water & institutions; variable enforcement of tenancy protections.
flow=rent/share (crop) | I=Sindh Tenancy Act (selective enforcement) | K=batai/adhi; local cost-sharing | periodicity=seasonal | discretion=high
Collective tenants resisting conversion to cash rents, 2000s ('Malki ya Maut').
